General Outcome 5 (Gr. 2)


Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

14553FA40CA44A6AA30BE482AF2152B7.description: ask relevant questions to clarify understanding and to have information explained

BA94438029784FA985C1421E8AB48097.description: Use effective oral and visual communication

7F68B91B660F430086D0D2C47043422D.description: use phonic knowledge and skills and visual memory to spell words of more than one syllable, high frequency irregular words and regular plurals in own writing

General Outcome 4 (Gr. 2)


Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

D76BD2D14F684359A6FCEEF7C89A5A3F.description: ask questions to focus on particular aspects of topics for own investigations

18086BD68A3E4B9E9AE95163AA18F4D1.description: relate personal knowledge to ideas and information in oral, print and other media texts

24BBEA36E9C54DE3B42F3A409EBFE68A.description:
General Outcome 3 (Gr. 2)


Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

9A3A82AD4C5F4312B63EF1D4A3D6F96A.description: use traditional story beginnings, patterns and stock characters in own oral, print and other media texts

21485E7D1E3047E09520FB5BEAD7847F.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas

6309D291BE904F2E8E8FD29192CD36E2.description: use own and respond to others' ideas to create oral, print and other media texts

6B1B9C75AC1343B6BDB6FB6039AB4A66.description: identify how pictures, illustrations and special fonts relate to and enhance print and other media texts

C6A8605FC9504E4484550103B84559E4.description: Preview book covers and titles; look for familiar words, phrases and story patterns to assist with constructing and confirming meaning

B110CC08BA62481DBA92DE07665F5829.description: figure out, predict and monitor the meaning of unfamiliar words to make sense of reading, using cues such as pictures, context, phonics, grammatical awareness and background knowledge

96A8FCA80002474FBF0C342CFBFF8ECE.description: identify by sight an increasing number of high frequency words and familiar words from favourite books

D5F55F69DA8E4B4B8493206B6D244A73.description: use knowledge of oral language to predict words when reading stories and poems

5BA8C11821334842B01A880C66A924AB.description: Use knowledge of the organizational structures of print and stories, such as book covers, titles, pictures and typical beginnings, to construct and confirm meaning

FE3F1C2979744DDBAEDDB4DBB3671528.description: Connect personal experiences and knowledge of words, sentences and story patterns from previous reading experiences to construct and confirm meaning

7AFA8EAA13404F1EA2C3FE17BA2AC2F0.description: Use knowledge of how oral and written language is used in a variety of contexts to construct and confirm meaning

61ADBAB9031E4CEEA7C3F827CFED5EDD.description:
General Outcome 2 (Gr. 2)


Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

1F6496A56C6F4DD19109E4C40951D0C8.description: Record ideas and information in ways that make sense

258106CD60E3484E864A4F2B3BE7AAA6.description:
General Outcome 1 (Gr. 2)


Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences.
